intro: Swertia kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro swertia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its blue to violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are upright and branched. Swertia kilimandscharica is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
